- Hi! This is **Apurba Shil**; I am from India and I am pursuing my doctoal studies in Statistics and Epidemiology from the [Dept. of Public Health, Ben Gurion University](https://in.bgu.ac.il/en/fohs/public_health/Pages/default.aspx), Israel under the Kreitman Fellowship (2019-2023). **Welcome to my personal Website..**

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE, out.height='40%', out.width = '30%', fig.pos= 'H', fig.align="center"}

```

- My present focus of research is on exploring the common and rare genetic variations in the Autism Spectrum Disorders (ASDs).

- I received my Masters degree from the [Institute of Medical Sciences, Banaras Hindu University](http://www.bhu.ac.in/ims/), Varanasi, India in 2014-16.

- I did my M.Phil. in Biostatistics and Epidemiology from [International Institute for Population Sciences (IIPS)](http://www.iipsindia.ac.in/), Mumbai, India in 2016-17.

- I worked as a summer trainee at the [National Institute of Medical Statistics (NIMS)](http://nims-icmr.nic.in/NIMS/index.jsp), New Delhi, India in 2015. 

- I also worked as a Data Analyst at the [Karnataka Health Promotion Trust (KHPT)](http://www.khpt.org/), Bangalore, India in 2017.

- At the Ben Gurion University, I have successfully completed the *Deep learning in computational biology using Python programming language* and *Advanced epidemiological analysis using R programming language* courses.
